text:
(1) Coney Island Boardwalk (Riegelmann Boardwalk), west from West 19th Street, showing Ravenhall's Pavilion in the foreground.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, looking north to Surf Ave. West 19th Street is parallel to Ravenhall's property.

December 1923.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3) The same, another view.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(4) The same, showing the hotel in the grounds which was established in 1874. Jos. J. Satori and Jos. Balzarini are the owners.

March 31, 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

title: Islands - Coney Island - [Riegelmann boardwalk.]

text:
Surf Ave., north side, between West 20th (left), and West 19th Streets. The two frame buildings at the left, were demolished prior to 1929, and the Sea-Crest Apartments were erected thereon.

January 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

West 19th Street, west side, between Surf Ave., and the "Boardwalk", showing Ravenhall's Hotel; established in 1874.

March 31, 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Surf Ave,, at the N. W. corner of West 19th Street, showing a "Hot- dog stand" and a young girl selling cherries.

July 4, 1933.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
